greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of 1/2 - (phi(-q)^2 + phi(-q^9)^2) / 4 in powers of q where phi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2500
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of 1/2 - (eta(q)^4 * eta(q^18)^2 + eta(q^2)^2 * eta(q^9)^4) / (2 * eta(q^2) * eta(q^18))^2 in powers of q. - _Michael Somos_, Jun 02 2015
a(n) is multiplicative with a(2^e) = -1 if e>0, a(3^e) = 1 + (-1)^e if e>0, a(p^e) = (1 + (-1)^e) / 2 if p == 3 (mod 4), a(p^e) = e+1 if p == 1 (mod 4).
-2 * a(n) = A258322(n) unless n = 0 or n == 2 (mod 3).
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ 1/2 - (EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, q]^2 + EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, q^9]^2) / 4, {q, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Jun 02 2015 *)
results.author: _Michael Somos_, May 25 2015
